website_summaries.verdict: A smaller unicycle that works well for beginners.
pros: This unicycle adjusts well for people up to 5'11" and has a sturdy frame
A great choice for beginners young and old
cons: Pedals may become loose after moderate use

customer_reviews.title: Great Unicycle!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a Christmas gift for my 14 year old. I did a fair amount of research regarding different cycles, wheel size, etc as I wanted one that was great for beginners but also would remain fun and be good for tricks etc as skill level increased. This unicycle perfectly fills that need and has been a blast accommodating everyone in our family from the youngest at age 13 to adults. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: keri

customer_reviews.title: A great buy for a 9 year old!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic first unicycle for my nine-year-old girl. We challenged her to go 10 feet independently in her after school circus class. After a few months, she completed that goal and we purchase this is a reward! Since then, it’s taken a real beating on our driveway, but still going strong! It’s nothing fancy, but the adjustable seat works very well! It was a bit too tall for her, so my husband sawed off a few inches of the seat so it could lower to her height. My daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Ems

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered quickly & is built well. Make sure you read the assembly directions. People who bought this & didn’t read the directions are the ones that are complaining about the pedals falling off in their product reviews. You actually have to use a wrench to tighten them.
customer_reviews.author: SchrutePharms

customer_reviews.title: Great starting Uni
customer_reviews.text: Great starting Uni. I learned within a month practicing a couple times a week. Great for beginners, I'm 5'6" and 160 pounds
customer_reviews.author: Carson Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner unicycle
customer_reviews.text: My son is 5'3" and ~100 pounds. This unicycle fits him with the seat all the way down. It can just adjust all the way up for my 6'2" frame. The unicycle itself seems to be fairly well made. The plastic seat front and back are great at taking the repeated hits on the pavement as my son learns to ride it. I think this is a good starter unicycle. Only negative is that they shipped it in blue when we had ordered red.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged and missing pieces -all 4 screws, 6 out of 8 nuts, 5 out of 8 washers, and 1 out of 4 bolts. Once I get a chance to go to the hardware store I'll assemble and update with the unicycle stuffs.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is in German with small pictures as instructions.
customer_reviews.text: It seems like I’m missing some of the parts. The instructions are mostly in German so I have no idea what parts are supposed to be included, also the screws aren’t long enough to connect the fork retainer to the axle retainers. The pictures are small. I’m just straight up annoyed with this. I’m not an idiot, I can assemble things with ease, usually without instructions, but this is just ridiculous. I swear the screws they sent are the wrong size.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy!
customer_reviews.text: Our 12 year has had a blast learning to unicycle! It has taken a lot of work but it’s been just a couple weeks and he is definitely getting it. My only complaint is at first the tire kept going flat, luckily my husband knows a thing or two and took the wheel apart and fixed the spoke tip that was causing the problem. Other than that it is sturdy- has taken a lot of falls- oh and glad we bought elbow pads and wrist guards 😉
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Smith

customer_reviews.title: First time riders opinion (6ft, 220 lbs)
customer_reviews.text: Assembled this myself (instructions are primarily in German, however, there ARE English instructions directly underneath) with little issues. Ive never rode a unicycle until this one, and it hasn’t been too bad. I have banged up ankles on the pedals and legs a bit but I think that’s part of the learning process. Can’t tell you if the bike is for beginners or not but I like it? Seat is a little uncomfortable. Also, I am 6 foot and 220 pounds, hasn’t fallen apart on me and have been riding it for a week now. Word of advice, start by balancing on something before you try to ride solo.
customer_reviews.author: Kristahl Parker

customer_reviews.title: it looks real nice. my post got cut off
customer_reviews.text: its built cheaply but works. the seat is really good. pedals are cheap. actually plastic and plastic that screws into metal. the way the tire attaches worries me its a half moon bracket with two screws. im afraid with heavy use nut will loosen and crash goes the rider. so i check frequently. the seat sits high im 5'9" and i have seat all the way down to ride. if your shorter than 5"6' i think seat would be to high. but for 80 bucks its good enough for rideing up and down the street. if you plan on marathon rides, like on a bike path, id get a schwinn or better quality. this ones ggood just
customer_reviews.author: texas cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I’m really happy with the company. My son received this for an Xmas gift from me. When he went to put it together the pedal wouldn’t screw in due to excess chrome left in groves. It happens. No biggie. I went online and requested a return for a new item on Xmas day! Two days later he had a new one!! And they prepaid for me to ship the old one back! I was so surprised at the quick turn around! My son now has his unicycle together. Trying to ride it, well that’s a whole other task lol
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great Unicycle
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the same old unicycle for 6 years and it was time for an upgrade. Putting it together was really easy, the directions were very detailed. While the tire size is small compared to what I'm used to, it is still easy to use. The seat to the unicycle is well thought out. While teaching others to ride the unicycle it was dropped plenty of times and the bumpers really came in handy. It's easy to adjust the seat and it comes out completely for easy storage or transport.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Maddock

customer_reviews.title: Tire defective upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: My son rode this 2 times and the tire went flat. (He only weighs 85 lbs) There was a leak in the tire and we had to replace it on day 3. Granted, the replacement tire only cost $6.00, but the aggravation of getting a new defected product is not fun. The actual unicycle is nice and sturdy. At 12 yrs old, he’s picked this up well. It’s a good size for his age and seems to work fine after replacing the tire.
customer_reviews.author: twinsmom

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broke after an hour. Bolts don't hold the wheel in place. 1 star because somebody could get seriously hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Stapled through tire! When box was closed. Tried to inflate to check could hear hissing. When I removed pump, stem broke off. What a waste of money. Very disappointing. Was bought for son’s birthday. Didn’t even get it assembled to see if anything else is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: It's a great learning unicycle
customer_reviews.text: It's a great learning unicycle. I'm a cyclist, so I recognze these are very cheap parts, but, the way it's engineered, they should be fine. The pedals are a little too cheap, and will likely need to be replaced soon, but otherwise the saddle is holding up, and there isn't much to the rest of it, so it's all good. Overall, I am very happy with the quality for the price I paid. I couldn't get a cheaper price on a used Unicycle on Craigslist, so there you go!
customer_reviews.author: N. Cestra

customer_reviews.title: Threading on pedals corrupted.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the product with defective threading for the pedals. Both of them kept popping off after each ride. Hope it doesn’t happen to yours.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great core workout and lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was a good, sturdy uni to start out on but not enough seat height for my 6’ tall body. After about 10 hours of practice I borrowed a friend’s 24” unicycle to try and behold, it was much easier with the taller seat and longer pedal throw. So, if you’re a taller adult or teen I would suggest starting out on a 24” unicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to learn
customer_reviews.text: My husband thought it would be cool to get a unicycle and he also thought it would be super easy to learn, but boy was he wrong. He watched all the videos he could find and tried learning for days, but he found that it’s extremely difficult. I’d say it just takes a lot of time and practice to get even close to being good at riding a unicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Satterfield

customer_reviews.title: Fun until the novelty ends.
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my 14 y/o son. This product is fine for a kid that will try anything for a little while, but I'm not sure of the quality of the product for the long haul. The right pedal unscrewed a few times while riding. The seat post is not the highest quality either. But overall, my son is enjoying the unicycle for now, I guess that's all that matters for now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D.

customer_reviews.title: Fun great product no complaint.
customer_reviews.text: It's not easy to learn takes some determination, but that's no fault of the product it is a great product. It took my son about a week on and off to learn how to ride it. Watch YouTube videos!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good value. (I think
customer_reviews.text: Good value. (I think.) Left pedal shaft threading was weak and loose. Pedal thread was stripped upon assembly. Vendor replaced promptly. Same thing. Left pedal shaft not milled to correct size. (Too big.) Added several winds of teflon tape to tighten fit. Let's hope. Rest of unicycle seems robust and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: lou siegel

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: I see reviews where they can't tighten the seat or have other issues. None of those issues here. The assembly to tighten the seat does need to be adjusted to fit correctly, but that type of assembly is built with adjustment to work perfect. This works for my 11 year old son, but a little large for my 9. I just ordered the 16" for my 9 year old son. We will see if I keep 5 stars with that model.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Decent outdoor entertainment
customer_reviews.text: The Seat doesn’t stay on, it’s very loose and roasters side to side, which makes riding it even more difficult- Not that I can even ride it, but it’s sure fun watching people try! The tires don’t seem to stay inflated. I don’t know much about unicycles to give an opinion on anything else! It was purchased for our family, so people weighing 90-190 lbs have been on the unicycle. That’s all I got!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Return
customer_reviews.text: Bike seat does not lock in. It swivels when you try to sit on it. Which makes it dangerous.. trying to return but I get no answer.... So aggravating.. save your money.. I want my money back..
customer_reviews.author: o-no nancey

customer_reviews.title: Fluency in German beneficial for assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Wrong hardware sent for assembly (nuts, bolts, and washers). Haven't had a chance to get put together to rate based on a fully functional product. Instructions are mainly in German. Not a huge deal for assembly, but not being literate in German makes the warnings and additional information unreadable without a translation. Once I have acquired the right materials and the kids have had a chance to take it for a test run, I will come back and update review. Update: The hardware in used to replace the bolts provided were #12-24 x 1-1/2 in pack of machine screws. This gave me a screw head for leverage to tighten the lock nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Courtland J Halbrook

customer_reviews.title: Works great! A little short for me.
customer_reviews.text: My friend and I have been learning on this unicycle for the last 2 days and it has been marvelous. It has smacked into the concrete hundreds of times and it still looks and functions as well as new. My only issue is that I am 6'4" and it is not tall enough. My knee never extends past 120 degrees, maybe less. So the hight isn't ideal, but it's still usable. Additionally, the lever-adjust seat post is convenient when my much shorter friend takes his turn to try it out. FYI: Would not recommend learning indoors, unless the aesthetic of tire marks on the walls near the floor attracts you.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Nice and tough
customer_reviews.text: Nice and tough. Dont get this thing and expect to go quickly, it is 20 inches. However, most people can fit on this comfortable, and whenyou rock back and forth to stay in place, you arent covereing a lot of ground when people watch you. In other words, the smaller wheel covers less distance in every way, and that prevents a risk of crashing into people when you change legs in an idle. It is perfect for my usage.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to learn quick so I went to the biggest hill near my home and i instantly regret it because i was probably going like 40mph on the unicycle not knowing how to ride it going down hill then the police chased me till i got to a stop sign and now I have court on Friday
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun hurting myself and my friends with this
customer_reviews.text: Well made and way harder to learn to ride than I thought. Lots of fun hurting myself and my friends with this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark & Michelle Williams

customer_reviews.title: A Cheap One to Learn on but it won’t last
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, poorly made. After a couple months the axle broke where the crank attaches (see pic).
customer_reviews.author: R. Haun

customer_reviews.title: Bottom of the line but functional and FUN
customer_reviews.text: I'm learning it now and having fun. Using it for cross training to strengthen core and other muscles. *Update after four weeks the right pedal got loose and was at an extreme angle. I took it to a bike shop and they said the crank was stripped. I haven't been able to find the information on the company to order a new crank, and, I figure, it will keep wearing out quickly anyway. I tried Loctite to hold the pedal in but it didn't work. To keep using this Unicycle I would probably need to find a different manufacturer for more solid parts on the cranks and pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Paul Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Missing Components
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed. Just unboxed it and discovered that the bag that holds the screws and bolts was torn open. I am missing a bolt, nut, and spacer, so I cannot assemble the unicycle. The box itself was not damaged so this confirms that the product was damaged or altered before it was shipped out.
customer_reviews.author: matt7781

customer_reviews.title: Pedal Stripping
customer_reviews.text: Rode it three times before the right pedal came off and stripped the threading off the bolt hole. Now the pedal won’t go in at all. Very hard to get in contact with the vendor company to rectify this.
customer_reviews.author: Tara R.

customer_reviews.title: The inner tube had a leak before even putting it together... :(
customer_reviews.text: I'm super excited about this purchase! I've always wanted to learn how to ride a unicycle. I was pretty bummed when I went to put air up the tire for the first time before even assembling it and I could hear the air leaking out. The tube or stem has a leak and it went completely flat in minutes. Not sure whether it's worth contacting the seller or not. I'll probably end up running to Walmart after work and buying a new tube so I can start riding it right away. Other than that, the package arrived on time, was well packed and looks to be in perfect shape. Can't wait to start riding!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Story

customer_reviews.title: Pedal problem
customer_reviews.text: My son loved it! Rode it almost everyday until one of the pedals started to fall off. The threads are cheap and the pedal continues to fall off. He is pretty much over it now and it sits in the garage, pedal next to it on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift. A few days before Christmas I decided to assemble it, only to find out there were no nuts/bolts and some other parts that are only mentioned in the list of items, but no where in the instructions, so I’m not sure how important those items are. I’m worried the integrity of it will be compromised if I try to purchase replacement nuts & bolts.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my nephew
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas present for my 13 year old nephew. It is really good quality and easy to assemble. It arrived in decent amount of time. I can't say much on how it works as I am not a unicyclest myself and he is still teaching himself, but he loves it@
customer_reviews.author: Heather Sapp

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 9 year old daughter shes learning how to unicycle. Basically it fit our needs shes still using it. Only thing thtas not perfect is the seat shifts slightly no matter how much you tighten it. Still disable. Lasting color
customer_reviews.author: Danny Emel

customer_reviews.title: Unicycle is awesome. Packaging is pretty bad.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my brother for Christmas and he is obsessed. It's a really good quality cycle. The only reason it is 4 stars is that the first box we received was pretty beat up and the cycle was scratched pretty bad. Second box was beat up too but the part where the hole was didn't damage the product. It is not packaged well. Great unicycle though!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Laurence

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding uni-cycle for the price. Works as advertised and ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding uni-cycle for the price. Works as advertised and shipped on time. The box used to ship the uni-cycle was heavy duty so no parts were damaged in transit.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Short cranks
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I dislike about it is the cranks are 107mm they are pretty short best langth for beginners is 114mm to 125mm. Probably going to upgrade them with some 125s
customer_reviews.author: VATI SITRI

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Seems like good quality. Was a gift for my daughter (12 year old, 5’2”), and it’s a good size for her. It’s not easy to ride, but I don’t think any are for a beginner. She’s working on it though.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It's a unicycle....
customer_reviews.text: It's NOT easy to learn! lol. With that said, my son LOVES this and is determined to learn how to ride it! The only thing people should know is that if you have an inseam 25" or less, you'll have to cut the seatpost for little legs to reach the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Branner

customer_reviews.title: to old for unicycles
customer_reviews.text: I'm 58 yrs of age now - I used to be amazing on a unicycle back in the 70's - rode it every where - used to jump curbs; rode it to school ect-- thought I'd get one cause I have a grandaughter now - and show how cool grandpa is --- bad mistake -just kidding - I tried it just once -being 40lbs more then I was then - did 2 tumbles on the ground - decided I'll try another day - which has'nt come yet !!!??? as far as the product goes - very well built- good product {you wan't to buy mine??}
customer_reviews.author: sean t

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable one wheeled wonder.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy unicycle for beginners and pros alike. Listen to the repeated thuds as your child learns to ride. Well made. We haven't had any breakages of the unicycle or the riders. So great we actually bought two. Adjustable seat. Assembly was straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Butler

customer_reviews.title: I had to assemble which was not a big deal cuz I've had other unicycles but I thought they could have at least packaged it better. Rides smooth
customer_reviews.text: The box came damaged with all the nuts and bolts loose inside. I had to assemble which was not a big deal cuz I've had other unicycles but I thought they could have at least packaged it better. Rides smooth ..pretty color

customer_reviews.title: My 6' 2" son loves it
customer_reviews.text: This exceeded our expectations. It is a perfect beginners bike. He loves it and it fits his larger height with an adjustable length seat.
customer_reviews.author: Wecraven0033

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The fork had several pretty significant scratches. Otherwise, it is fine for our 13 year old to learn on. She was just disappointed by the defects since she had saved up her own money to purchase it with the expectation that it would arrive in new, pristine condition. Also, the clamp to attach the wheel doesn't fit quite right. It was very difficult to attach.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Parenti

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my daughter. Definitely not easy to learn but what unicycle is?! She totally loves it though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun to ride
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 17 years old son. He is very athletic so it was easy for him to learn. It is very good quality. I fully recommend it. It is very fun and challenging
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Leon

customer_reviews.title: Good for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Big hit. Easy to assemble. Very sturdy and well made. It’s the first unicycle I’ve seen in person but it seems like it’s pretty high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade for my son.
customer_reviews.text: Great unicycle for the price. My son has been riding his unicycle for two years and had outgrown his old one. We bought this as an upgrade and it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: L Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Me an my brother practice together. Thought it would be a fun skill to learn and we are both glutens for punishment. A few falls here and there adds to the fun! Fun unique activity. Can’t beat the price! Might be easier to learn with a slightly bigger wheel though. But the price and the assembly is great for beginners
customer_reviews.author: Sphing

customer_reviews.title: Unusable. Correction, user error.
customer_reviews.text: Unusable once assembled. The seat post clamp does not clamp tight enough to prevent the seat from freespinning. It is actually dangerous to ride because of that, so if i want to use this i have to modify it. I guess i thought the bolt on the quick release clamp was tight enough. When i tightened the bolt a LOT, the seat is nice and sturdy. Good beginner unicycle, can't wait to master it.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: leaky inner tube
customer_reviews.text: Had to pump it up several times in an hour of use. Will have to disassemble to get to the tube, so I'm not happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Truxaw

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for beginner to learn.
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginner. Decent quality and not professional quality, but doable.
customer_reviews.author: lightningblot

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: This unicycle has done me wonders so far. I can easily ride just after 3 days of full practice! Assembly was a bit confusing, only because the instructions aren’t at all detailed. So you kind of have to figure it out yourself. The seat is very durable after many falls. Over all it’s worth the buy, especially for this price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unicycle
customer_reviews.text: Good and sturdy unicycle but a little high for my 14 year old son.
customer_reviews.author: Niki N.

customer_reviews.title: Needs a tube for the tire.
customer_reviews.text: I knew how to ride one. I rode one of these 23 years ago right before I had cancer in 9th grade. I wanted to see if i could ride one again. And i still can. I need a tube for the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun. Learn something new!
customer_reviews.text: Great unicycle to learn how to ride. I’ve gotten fairly good using only this unicycle. It took me about 4 hours to start riding. Wear a helmet!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Good for learning
customer_reviews.text: I learned how to unicycle in two weeks with just around 30 minutes per day on this. Once you get good, you might wanna buy a 24" unicycle for long distance.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap clasp
customer_reviews.text: Clasp is kind of weak so swat moves and turns even when it’s tightened all the way. Other than that seems like a good unicycle for beginners!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Schmieder

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: The weld point on the seat broke the first day. Learning to ride on a carpet, when the bike hit the carpet, the seat broke off. Terrible workmanship on the weld points. Ordered this for a Christmas gift for my grandson on October 25, and by the time he received it on Christmas, the return period was closed. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: AshtonHouse

customer_reviews.title: Unicycles
customer_reviews.text: It's a unicycle and I unicycle on it. 10 out of 10! I haven't ridden any other so I don't have any frame of reference, but it appears pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Noel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: The unicycle is a little bigger than expected, but it's not hindering the kids in their efforts to learn to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Gregory

customer_reviews.title: My 14-year-old son says Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It took him a while to get the hang of it, but now he can ride it. My impression, putting this together, is that it is a solid, quality product.
customer_reviews.author: MDG

customer_reviews.title: Fun at first but my grandson needs a lot of practice.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grandson, right now it sits alone until the weather gets cooler so he can master the trick of riding it.
customer_reviews.author: susan lally

customer_reviews.title: Great first unicycle
customer_reviews.text: This is my first unicycle and i am very happy with it. There is a thick plastic guard around the front and the back of the seat and i quickly realized why it was there. Everytime the unicycle falls it hits that guard. HARD!!! The guard has withstanded pretty well after falling hundreds of times. The pedals are pretty crappy but just learning how to ride i havent put them through much damage yet and they are still holding pretty good. The seat is awful though for men with its banana shape isnt to comfy on the private area but overall good unicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Frequentbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money buying this unicycle
customer_reviews.text: We have had this unicycle 1 month. The pedal keeps falling off and the unicycle is unusable anymore. Don't waste your money buying this unicycle. VERY POOR QUALITY!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be good quality
customer_reviews.text: I can't truly speak on this, but my boyfriend says it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Torn seat
customer_reviews.text: The seat arrived with a tear. It's too small a tear to be worth the trouble of returning but I wish there were a way to contact the seller for a new seat
customer_reviews.author: Trout52

customer_reviews.title: Gets you on one wheel at low cost.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, easy to assemble, unicycle. Not super sturdy but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Benne

customer_reviews.title: Seems fun but really hard
customer_reviews.text: It's way too high and not easy to learn at all. Gave it to my daughter for her birthday and it's just sat on the garage because of how difficult it is.
customer_reviews.author: Piquant

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my 11 year old . Sturdy with a great weight to it .
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo these are hard to ride 🤣 but the practice stays!
customer_reviews.author: Deseree' Jean Shuler

customer_reviews.title: good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This is OK for the price but the stock pedals, Tyre and seat clamp are pretty average and we have swapped them out.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit too tall for my average 11 year old. My husband cut an inch off the seat and it fits him perfectly with room to extend with age.
customer_reviews.author: Cheree Copelin

customer_reviews.title: Parts Missing
customer_reviews.text: More than half the pieces needed to put this together are missing. The baggy they were contained in was sealed properly, but missing most pieces. Can't tell you how this works because I can't put it together without the parts.
customer_reviews.author: BBR

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Very well built product and were able to assemble ourselves after the dog ate the instructions. Ha.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Have

customer_reviews.title: Pedal came loose. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: One of the pedal cranks came loose and the screw holding it in place got stripped, so there's no way to tighten it. Had to return it. My son, who weighs about 145 pounds, used only about a dozen times.
customer_reviews.author: SFBoiler

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'11 180 lbs (180 cm, 82 kg), and the 20 inch fits only if I extend the seat post all the way out. I've had the unicycle for about 3 months, and went from never ridding one before to being able to ride relatively confidently on a smooth, open surface! However, it suffered a lot of abuse while I was learning -- including a broken pedal and stripped out crank. In spite of that, I think the build quality is pretty good for the price, and I would recommend it for a learning unicycle, especially for a kid or smaller adult, and especially if you're not sure you're really serious about it.
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Parts not usable, cannot assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Unable to attach one of the pedals to the crank. Threads will not engage. What do I do?
customer_reviews.author: E Murray

customer_reviews.title: ....not as easy as it was 40 years ago...
customer_reviews.text: Well made and fairly easy to put together. It’s still much more difficult 40 years later. Practice practice practice.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dufault

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great product, was able to hold my 210lb body. It is for kids though, can tell since my fingers don't fit on the handle. Lots of fun, great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Enrique Segebre

customer_reviews.title: Looked tall for my short kids, but they seemed ...
customer_reviews.text: Looked tall for my short kids, but they seemed to have figured it out and are doing well on it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Risky.
customer_reviews.text: Very sad that it arrived with missing screws and the seat was ripped. Decided to just return it.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Yall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great and easy to put together and came quickly
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: It took hundreds (even thousands!) of serious falls and it's still working perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: A. K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly. The inside packing box had some damage
customer_reviews.text: Our Grandson John likes the unicycle very much; unfortunately, he will have to grow into it.The 20" is just a tad large for a 9 year old. Easy assembly. The inside packing box had some damage, wish that had been noted by Amazon before packing into the larger crate for shipping. This very heavy item just had too much jump around room in the larger crate and a tighter pack was needed. All in all, good product for the price and appears to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Milano

customer_reviews.title: Great starter unicycle
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 10 and 8 year old boys and I've been very pleased. They are working hard to learn to ride, great unicycle for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Joy P. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Nice cycle, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Now to learn to ride the thing, but I have good balance shouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: W.F.BJr.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Sent this to my boyfriend for a Christmas gift and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good starter unicycle. Has survived many drops. FYI good idea to protect the edges with duct or painter's tape
customer_reviews.author: jkll

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts in the box
customer_reviews.text: We are missing parts that connect the fork to the tire. No info on who to contact to replace!! Hopefully we do not have to return everything and can just get parts that were never in the box sent to us.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jenson

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for my son's 10th birthday. He loves it! It's been dropped, kicked, and slammed and still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kbrown0918

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a few days into learning how to ride it and having a great time. I named it Bike Wazowski and after having a little difficulty figuring out how to tighten the bolts, I've been on it ever since
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: he was mounting and riding better than my husband who has been riding for years
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this unicycle. It took him only the weekend to master this! By day three, he was mounting and riding better than my husband who has been riding for years! Arrived quickly, perfect size, exactly as described!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Just order the cheap one, your gonna end up with it anyway
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the black model of this and was charged the $130 for it, received the $62 chrome one. As for assembly the instructions are in German only but its not rocket science to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Harry cox

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived ripped open on both sides from the metal attached to the wheel, multiple pieces are missing. Unable to assemble due to the lost items. Unicycle itself arrived undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

product_meta.title: Fun 20 Inch Wheel Unicycle with Alloy Rim
feature_bullets: Ideal for the first time unicyclist or the regular rider
16" available in chrome or red, 20" available in chrome, red, black, blue, or yellow, 24" available in chrome
Quick release seat post clamp with comfortable saddle
Comes complete with a quality Kenda tire and aluminum rim
